text: Alba Fehérvár are a Hungarian professional basketball club based in Székesfehérvár that compete Nemzeti Bajnokság I, the premier division of basketball in Hungary. Founded as the successor of Székesfehérvári MDSE, they took the Hungarian championship title five times and won the Hungarian cup on four occasions. In addition, Albacomp also were crowned as the Central European Basketball League champions in 2009. ==Players== ===Retired numbers=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center" |- | colspan="6" style="background:#0038af; color:#FFFFFF;"| Alba retired numbers |- ! style="width:40px; background:#0038af; color:#FFFFFF;"| N° ! style="width:40px; background:#0038af; color:#FFFFFF;"| ! style="width:160px; background:#0038af; color:#FFFFFF;"|Player ! style="width:40px; background:#0038af; color:#FFFFFF;"|Position ! style="width:160px; background:#0038af; color:#FFFFFF;"|Tenure ! style="width:160px; background:#0038af; color:#FFFFFF;"|Date Retired |- | 9 || || style="text- align:left;"| Kornél Dávid || PF || 1996–2000 || 2001 |- |} ===Current roster=== ===Depth chart=== == Honours == ===Domestic competitions=== Nemzeti Bajnokság I/A (National Championship of Hungary) *15px Champions (5): 1997–98, 1998–99, 1999–00, 2012–13, 2016–17 *15px Runners-up (3): 2005–06, 2010–11, 2015–16 *15px Third place (5): 1995–96, 2003–04, 2004–05, 2007–08, 2011–12, 2017-18 Magyar Kupa (National Cup of Hungary) *15px Winners (4): 1999, 1990, 2013, 2017 *15px Runners-up (3): 2004, 2005, 2011 ===European competitions=== *Central European Basketball League (1): ** 2009 ==Season by season== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:88%;" |- bgcolor= !
